intro: Bumelia arachnoidea, commonly known as the spiderplant tree, is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is native to the southern United States and Mexico. It is characterized by its smooth, grayish-brown bark and its ability to produce a milky latex when wounded. The plant has alternate, simple leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a waxy coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by round, yellowish fruits containing a single seed. Bumelia arachnoidea is often found in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in woodland areas.
